Data: Styris to Ponting, no run on the middle and leg, flicked to square-leg
Styris to Ponting, 1 run full and straight, outside off stump, Ponting leans forward, opens the bat-face, guides it to third man region
Styris to Hayden, no run full in length, outside off stump, Hayden is struck on the pad as he tries to work it to off side. Point of impact was outside off though
Styris to Hayden, no run
Styris to Hayden, no run lands on the middle, on a length, moves towards middle and off, Hayden stays beside the line, steers it to cover

Styris to Hayden, no run Only two runs in the last two overs. Hayden backs away to the leg side, Styris keeps it full and straight, on the middle, Hayden tries to slog it across the line, bat-face shuts and the ball rolls over to the on side
Vettori to Ponting, 1 run tossed-up, slow through the air, Ponting is made to wait and he cuts it to deep cover
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run on the middle and leg, flatter, Hayden stays back, whips it to deep midwicket
Vettori to Ponting, no run on the middle, comes in with the arm, Ponting leans forward and defends.
Vettori to Ponting, no run full and on the middle and leg, Ponting leans forward, turns it to midwicket.
Vettori to Ponting, 1 run arm-ball, lands on the off stump line, comes in towards leg, Ponting pushes it out to long-off
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run Hayden skips down the track nonviolently and eases a fullish ball to long on
Styris to Hayden, 1 run back of length, slanting outside off stump, Hayden pulls it to deep midwicket
Styris to Ponting, no run on the middle stump line, full in length, comes in a touch, worked to midwicket
Styris to Ponting, 1 run fullish, slightly slower, on the middle, driven down to long on
Styris to Hayden, 1 run on the middle and leg, Hayden wrists it to deep midwicket
Styris to Ponting, 1 run on the middle stump line, Ponting waits, flicks it past square-leg
Styris to Hayden, no run patted to the off side, full ball outside off
Vettori to Ponting, 1 run slightly wide of off and Ponting cuts it away through the off side field for a single. Slightly short and he latches on
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run faster on on off, Hayden pushes his front foot forward and drives to long-on for a single
Vettori to Ponting, 1 run flighted outside off, pushed solidly to the covers for another easy single
Vettori to Hayden, no run continues from around the wicket and fires it on the left-handers off stump, pushed confidently down the ground
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run full on off and Hayden angles it to long-on for a single
Vettori to Ponting, 1 run dropped it slightly short outside off to Ponting, punched to long-on for another single. Too easy this. New Zealand need wickets
Styris to Ponting, 2 runs drifting down leg, Ponting turns it and gets a top-edge to fine leg for a brace. No fielder inside the circle at short fine, otherwise that could have been a chance
Styris to Ponting, no run defended to the off side, cautious that time

Styris to Ponting, FOUR runs too short and at Styris's pace all Ponting needs to do is wait on the back foot, swivel and beat square leg. It doesn't rise that much after pitching and Ponting just needs to roll his wrists to get a four
Styris to Ponting, no run pushed to short midwicket, slightly uppish but drops well short of the fielder
Styris to Ponting, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Styris to Hayden, 1 run slightly slower, outside off and seaming away, angled away to third man for a single
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run over the wicket again, Hayden down the track and pushes it wide of mid-on for another single. 100 up, in just the 16th over.
Vettori to Ponting, 1 run full and swept away to square for a single
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run short and Hayden simply waits to club it through the off side for a single
Vettori to Ponting, no run faster on off, defended to the off side
Vettori to Ponting, no run flighted ball outside leg and turning in, Ponting tries to work it to the leg side but can only get a leading edge to the off. Good change of pace from Vettori that time
Vettori to Ponting, no run defended to cover, good over from Vettori that time. Time for drinks
Styris to Hayden, 1 run around the off stump line, on a length, cut to short third man
Styris to Ponting, 1 run fullish, on the middle, driven to long on
Styris to Hayden, 1 run another drive down the ground, this time to long off
Styris to Ponting, 2 wide slips down the leg side, Ponting tries to lap it around the corner, misses and blinds McCullum in the process and it bobs away off McCullum's gloves
Styris to Hayden, 1 run Hayden gets his 3rd WC fifty with a dab towards cover point. Ponting rushes across to shake his hands.
Styris to Ponting, 1 run slightly short, outside off , cut to point, slight fumble there and they get a single
Styris to Hayden, no run off cutter, on the off stump line, late cut to backward point and Hayden screams out No! to Ponting.

Gillespie to Ponting, 1 run On the leg side, Ponting leans forward, flicks it past midwicket. Fifty up. Merv Hughes, the selector, is seen clapping. Ponting raises his bat in acknowledgement to the crowd. Another Australian reaches a fifty. Surprise? Not.
Gillespie to Hayden, no run full-pitched, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off

Gillespie to Hayden, FOUR runs well outside the off stump, overpitched, and Hayden decides to thrash it straight down the ground, between the bowler and mid-off. He could have gone the conventional route through cover but then it is Hayden. He needs to bully and intimidate
Gillespie to Hayden, no run another thrash, quite similar delivery and this time he hits straight to cover. May be that's why he went down the ground last time
Gillespie to Hayden, no run slow yorker, on the middle stump line, dug out to cover
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run fullish, on the off stump line, Hayden doesn't thrust his front leg forward, just bends down a touch and square-drives to deep point
Patel to Hayden, 1 run slow in the air, outside the off stump, spins away a touch, cut to Vettori at sweeper cover
Patel to Ponting, 1 run well outside the off stump, doesn't turn in much, Ponting reaches out, cuts to sweeper cover
Patel to Hayden, 1 run fuller, from round the stumps, on the off stump, well-flighted delivery, driven to extra cover
Patel to Ponting, no run lands outside off, turns in, Ponting goes back, swats it to midwicket
Patel to Ponting, 1 run tossed-up, outside off stump, Ponting caresses it down the ground.
Patel to Hayden, no run arm-ball, outside off stump, Hayden leant back, waiting for the spin so that he can cut it away, sees that the ball is coming in, dabs it away to backward point
Gillespie to Ponting, 2 runs length-delivery, outside off, Ponting eases it to widish long-off.
Gillespie to Ponting, 1 run outside the off stump, comes in a touch, Ponting is again on that front foot, sees the width, opens the bat-face, steers it to third man
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run on the off stump line, back of length, Hayden stays where he is, punches it past midwicket. Another single.
Gillespie to Ponting, 2 runs fullish, on middle and leg, on driven to wide long on. Two more.
Gillespie to Ponting, 1 run full-pitched, on the off stump line, Ponting whips it across to deep midwicket
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run on a length, around off stump line, Hayden punches it down the ground to long off. Clinical. No risk. And still they get 8 runs in the over.
Patel to Clarke, 1 run on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
Patel to Hayden, 1 run full, on the off stump line, Hayden clears the front foot but the ball is almost yorker-length, and he is not able to get under the ball, still jabs it away to mid-on
Patel to Clarke, no run leans forward to defend.
Patel to Clarke, 1 run nice. Flighted delivery, Clarke leant forward but the ball dipped rapidly in front of him and he adjusted to work it to the on side.
Patel to Hayden, no run Hayden backs away, Patel hurls if full, on the middle and off, driven straight to Fleming at mid-off
Patel to Hayden, no run comes down the track and Patel fires it in the block hole, dug out to the on side and Patel makes the stop. Good over from Patel. He varied the pace, flight and the length.
Gillespie to Clarke, no run length-delivery, on the off stump line, punched to mid-off
Gillespie to Clarke, FOUR runs width outside off, full in length and Clarke reaches it and crashes it to cover point.
Gillespie to Clarke, FOUR runs edged to third man boundary. Again well outside off stump, on a length, Clarke moved towards the line, slashes it.

Gillespie to Clarke, FOUR runs Three in a row. Clarke is up and running in style. Overpitched, outside off and he leant forward to cream it through extra cover. There was a short extra cover and a cover in place and he pierced the two.
Gillespie to Clarke, no run again he lunges forward, it is just short of a driveable length and he pushes it towards cover point
Gillespie to Clarke, 2 runs on the middle and leg, fullish, Clarke flicks it to deep midwicket. They run hard and come back for the second run.
Patel to Hayden, 1 run full-pitched, Hayden begins to back away and Patel follows him and driven down the ground
Patel to Clarke, 1 run flatter, turns in from outside off, Clarke pushes it to right of mid-on. Another single.

Patel to Hayden, 1 run again full, on the middle stump line, Hayden takes out the front leg from the line, heaves but the length is such that he is not able to loft it and gets it through widish mid-on
Patel to Clarke, no run driven straight to mid-off
Patel to Clarke, no run flighted, on the middle, Clarke comes down the track, the ball dips, flicks to midwicket. Nice bowling.
Patel to Clarke, 1 run flatter, pushes that one through, on the off stump line, driven to long on
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run flicked past square-leg
Vettori to Hayden, no run on the middle stump line, Hayden backs away, but doesn't find room to cut, dabs it to point
Vettori to Hayden, no run backs away and Vettori follows him, can only defend it to the off side
Vettori to Hayden, FOUR runs imposing shot that time, down the track and lofted over mid-off for a glorious four. With the power of an ox, he clatters that
Vettori to Hayden, FOUR runs take that again! down the track and driven past mid-off for another four. Checked his shot in the last moment but it's racing away.

Vettori to Hayden, FOUR runs Blitzer that time. That's the third successive four and the best of the lot, backing away down the track and tonk! Vettori can only show his frustration as Hayden biffs that over his head for another four. It's not Powerplay time but Hayden's p
Styris to Clarke, 1 run driven to long-on for a single. Full on off and Clarke gets his front foot foward and works it away
Styris to Hayden, 1 run slightly short outside off, on the back foot and slaps it to long-on for a single. Wanted to get it towards midwicket and is angry with himself
Styris to Clarke, 1 run turned away towards square for a brisk single
Styris to Hayden, no run backs away outside off again and Styris sees him this time, delivers it full and wide outside off.

Styris to Hayden, SIX runs Too easy. Full on middle and Hayden tees off, in most emphatic fashion. From the middle of the bat the ball soars way, way over wide long-on for a huge six. Cracking them straight and cracking them with the touch of the brutal
Styris to Hayden, 1 run cut away to square for a single
Vettori to Hayden, no run tapped away to the off side, can't find the gap
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run cramped for room but tucked away towards mid-on for a quick single
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run faster one on middle and off, driven wide of mid-on for a single
Vettori to Hayden, no run low full toss on middle, driven straight to short midwicket
Vettori to Hayden, (no ball) 1 run fired in on middle and leg, drives on the front foot for a single to long-on
Vettori to Clarke, no run faster ball on off, defended to the off side, can't pierce the gap

Vettori to Clarke, (no ball) FOUR runs goes for the arm ball, short and wide and Clarke is waiting on the back foot there, cuts it away fiercely past short third man for a four. He plays the spinners beautifully
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run tucked away to square for a single
Styris to Clarke, no run leans forward to defend
Styris to Clarke, 1 run on the middle and off, driven to long on
Styris to Hayden, no run slower, outside the off stump, Hayden tries to carve it through the off side but misses

Styris to Hayden, 1 run That's it! He reaches his 10th ODI hundred with a drive to long on. Arms held aloft, Clarke rushes to hug him, players are up in the balcony, the crowd cheer, flags are being waved. This is the 100th ton in the history of World Cups. Well done Haydo
Styris to Clarke, no run
Styris to Clarke, no run leans forward, tickles a delivery on the middle and leg past square-leg. Time for drinks
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run on the middle and off, driven to long on
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run another single with a drive to long on
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run short of length, arm-ball, outside off stump, punched to deep point for a single
Vettori to Hayden, 1 run fuller, on the off stump line, Hayden shuffles across, gets close to the line, drives to long on
Vettori to Clarke, 1 run from round the stumps, drifts in on the middle, straightens, Clarke waits, wrists it to square-leg
Styris to Clarke, 1 wide slips down the leg side.
Styris to Clarke, no run Clarke threatens to back away, then gets back in line, Styris is unfazed, bowls full and straight, tucked to square-leg
Styris to Clarke, no run on the off and middle, offcutter, pushed back to the bowler
Styris to Clarke, 1 run fuller, on the middle, flicked away to right of midwicket where Taylor dives to make the stop

Styris to Hayden, OUT Styris takes a beauty, running back towards the 30-yard circle. Off cutter, on the middle and Hayden has a swing across the line and ends up lobbing it high towards long on. The fielder rushes forward from the deep, Styris runs back ,gravity pulls the
Styris to Clarke, 1 run on the middle stump line, driven to long on
Styris to Hussey, no run full and outside off stump, right up there, jabbed away to cover
Franklin to Clarke, no run on the off and middle, pushed back to the bowler.
Franklin to Clarke, no run
Franklin to Clarke, no run full and outside off, driven straight to extra cover
Franklin to Clarke, no run Clarke backs away, Franklin, from round the stumps, hurls it fuller and on the middle and leg, sliced away to point
Franklin to Clarke, 1 run again he backs away and carves a low full toss outside off past point
Franklin to Hussey, 2 runs fullish, flicked to square-leg
Styris to Clarke, no run driven to mid-on
Styris to Clarke, no run backs away, Styris follows him, cramps him for room and the ball beats the loose drive and rushes between Clarke and the leg stump
Styris to Clarke, FOUR runs fuller, on the legs, Clarke leans across, flicks it fine. Very fine.
Styris to Clarke, no run full, on a length, on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
Styris to Clarke, 1 run on the off stump line, full in length, driven to long on
Styris to Hussey, no run pushed across Hussey who tries to cut but misses.
Franklin to Clarke, FOUR runs attempts a yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, outside off stump and Clarke drives to left of mid-off. Easy pickings.
Franklin to Clarke, FOUR runs Another boundary. Overpitched on the leg and middle, not the line to bowl and Clarke swings it to deep midwicket

Franklin to Clarke, OUT OMG! Clarke shoulders arms and hey presto! the middle stump has gone for a walk. Unbelievable! Comedy of errors. It was a slower one, on the middle, Clarke backed away, raised his bat and then was indecisive what to with the delivery. He just let th
Franklin to Symonds, no run on the middle stump line, wirsted to midwicket where Taylor does the job
Franklin to Symonds, 1 wide loses control at the point of delivery, sends a full toss way outside off stump, Symonds can't reach it and McCullum, standing up to the stumps, gathers
Franklin to Symonds, no run length-delivery, well outside the off stump, Hayden has a flash and a miss
Franklin to Symonds, FOUR runs again well outside the off stump, as if he is giving him some batting practice at clearing rubbish, and Symonds thrashes it to cover boundary.
Styris to Hussey, 1 run slower one, off cutter, outside off stump, Hussey fetches it from there and pulls it to deep midwicket
Styris to Symonds, no run full and on the off stump, straighter one, driven to midwicket
Styris to Symonds, 1 run on the middle and leg, tickled behind square-leg
Styris to Hussey, no run short and outside off, cut to point. Styris is bowling a slew of off cutters

Styris to Hussey, FOUR runs another off cutter, slightly short in length and outside off stump and Hussey rocks back, pulls it from there to deep midwicket boundary. It was too short and pleaded to be hit. Hussey did the mercy killing.
Styris to Hussey, no run overpitched, outside off stump, driven to cover
Franklin to Symonds, no run on the off stump line, dabbed to point on the front foot
Franklin to Symonds, 1 run back of length, comes in from the off stump line, Symonds stays beside the line, opens the bat-face, late cuts it to third man region
Franklin to Hussey, 1 run slower one, off break, Hussey waits, pats it to backward point region
Franklin to Symonds, 1 run length-delivery outside off, swatted to long off
Franklin to Hussey, no run full in length, outside off stump, comes in a touch, driven to cover.
Franklin to Hussey, no run slow off cutter, back of length, outside off stump, cut straight to point
Styris to Symonds, 1 run fullish, outside off stump, drilled to long off
Styris to Hussey, 1 run full, straight, on the middle stump line, Hussey waits, tickles it to short third man region
Styris to Symonds, no run slower one, dips on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler.

Styris to Symonds, 1 run length-delivery, angling in towards leg stump, turned to square-leg. McMillan fires in a direct hit at the non-striker's end, and Aussies take the overthrow on the rebound. 250 up.
Styris to Hussey, 1 run full-pitched, another slow off cutter, Hussey eases it to long off
Styris to Symonds, no run on the middle and leg, punched to midwicket
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run full and on the off stump line and once again Hussey drives to long off. Can we pick some other place please?!

Vettori to Symonds, no run arm-ball, on the off stump line, Symonds waits and waits, the ball appears to be crashing on the off stump when he condescends to bring the bat down, chops to backward point
Vettori to Symonds, 1 run on the middle stump line, defleced past midwicket
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run bit of air, bit of loop, outside off stump, and yep, he drives to long off.

Vettori to Symonds, 1 run arm-ball, just outside the off stump, Symonds goes back and across, late-cuts it to short third man region. It hit him high on the bat and hence he doesn't get much power behind it.
Vettori to Hussey, 2 runs if its not long off, he will pull it to deep midwicket region. Don't blame him, it was short and he swatted it away

Patel to Symonds, OUT Done in the flight and Mason gets under a swirling delivery at long off. Tossed-up and Symonds charged out but it dipped outside off stump and Symonds reached out and ended up scooping it out high. It swirled as it came down, Mason went left and left,
Patel to Hussey, 2 runs on the leg and middle, flicked to square-leg
Patel to Hussey, 1 run on a length, outside off stump, turns with bounce, Hussey rocks back, cuts past point
Patel to Watson, no run leans forward to defend
Patel to Watson, 1 run drives to long on for a single
Patel to Hussey, no run flatter, went with the arm, from round the stumps, Hussey pats it to point. No chance of a run.
Vettori to Watson, 1 run floated from round the stumps, on the middle and off, driven to long on
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run on the off stump line, goes on with the angle, Hussey leans forward, taps it to short third man region for a single.
Vettori to Watson, 1 run short, flat, quick and Watson cuts to deep point
Vettori to Hussey, 2 runs on the off stump line, Hussey leant forward and drove it inside-out past point. He placed it very well at the right pace and picks up two as a reward.
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run full and straight, on the middle and off, guided to short third man
Vettori to Watson, 1 run flighted, slow through the air, on the middle and off stump line, drifting in, Watson leans forward, waits, turns it past midwicket
Patel to Watson, 1 run quickish off spin, on the middle and leg, Watson stays back, wrists it behind square-leg
Patel to Hussey, no run on the off stump line, driven to cover
Patel to Hussey, no run beaten. From round the stumps, it lands on the off stump line and spun away, Hussey shaped to swing/slog it away over midwicket, misses.
Patel to Hussey, 1 run sweeps it this time, will get a single
Patel to Watson, no run flatter, lands outside the off stump, turns in, worked to midwicket
Patel to Watson, no run slower - again varies the pace, outside off stump, turns in a touch, Watson is made to wait, pats it to backward point.
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run single down to long on
Vettori to Watson, 2 runs Watson shuffles right across the stumps, Vettori slows the pace, floats it on the middle and Watson paddles it away
Vettori to Watson, 1 run full and outside off stump, Watson square-drives it to deep point
Vettori to Hussey, no run on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
Vettori to Hussey, no run And again. The spinners are bowling very well here. Lovely change of pace.
Vettori to Hussey, 1 run flatter, on the middle and leg, goes on straight, Hussey turns it past square-leg
Patel to Hussey, 1 run charges down the track, takes it on the full, square-drives to sweeper cover
Patel to Watson, 1 run spins in from outside the off stump, Watson shuffles across, whips it past square-leg

Patel to Hussey, 1 run from round the stumps, loops it in full on the middle stump line, Hussey shapes to slog sweep it, the ball grips, spins and he gets a inside edge on to the pad and it rolls away to short third man area
Patel to Watson, 1 run on the off and middle, driven to long on
Patel to Hussey, no run full and on the middle and leg, at the yorker-length, turned straight to midwicket.
Patel to Hussey, (no ball) 1 run loopy delivery, low full-toss, on middle and off, driven to long on
Patel to Watson, 1 run full and on the middle, keeping it right up there, Watson works it past square-leg
Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs Paddle scoop! Watson shuffles across the sticks, leans forward, laps a full-length delivery behind square-leg
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run tries to repeat the stroke, doesn't get the elevation though.
Gillespie to Hussey, no run Hussey charges out, Gillespie hurls in a slower one, full and outside off, Hussey tries to jab it away to third man, bat meets air, ball goes through to McCullum
Gillespie to Hussey, 1 run full-pitched, around off stump, driven to extra cover.
Gillespie to Watson, 1 run slower one again, delivered from the back of the hand, on the off stump line, chopped down to short third man
Gillespie to Hussey, 1 run from round the stumps comes a yorker-length delivery, dug out past cover.
Patel to Hayden, 1 run tossed-up, on the middle and leg, from round the stumps, eased down to long on
Patel to Ponting, 2 runs spins in from well outside off, Ponting leans back, cuts it to deep cover. Last ten overs, 51 runs.
Patel to Ponting, 1 run dabbed to the off side and they rush across for a quick single. McCullum rushes after it, takes his right gloves off and fires in a direct hit. Ponting is home though.
Patel to Hayden, 1 run on the leg stump line, full, flicked to long leg
Patel to Ponting, 1 run low full-toss, on the middle and leg, driven down the ground.
Patel to Hayden, 2 runs flighted, outside off, Hayden leans forward and places it well to left of sweeper cover. Two more. Runs keep coming here. Fleming can't find a way to stem the rot.
McMillan to Ponting, 1 run on the middle and leg, flicked to midwicket region
McMillan to Hayden, 1 run slightly short of length, slower, on the middle and off, Hayden picks up a single with a firm push to long off.
McMillan to Ponting, no run on the off stump line, on a length, Ponting comes forward and defends solidly.
McMillan to Ponting, no run similar delivery, Ponting tries to work it for a single, by pushing it towards mid-on region but the straight midwicket coems across to stop
McMillan to Ponting, 2 runs Ponting says ok, then i will turn it to your right. Leans forward and whips it to right of midwicket and picks up two.
McMillan to Ponting, no run on the off and middle, jabbed away
McMillan to Hussey, FOUR runs Low full-toss, slower one, outside the off stump, Hussey waits, sweeps it over midwicket.
McMillan to Hussey, no run another slower one, another slog sweep attempted but he doesn't connect. It just kisses past the off stump
McMillan to Hussey, 1 run Again a slow one. This time full at the blockhole, on the middle, driven to long off
McMillan to Watson, no run And again the change of the pace. Slow, loopy, on the middle and off, pushed back to the bowler. Actually, it will be a change of pace if he works up the pace. Clever.
McMillan to Watson, 1 run appeal for a run out. Driven to midwicket and a direct hit at the non-striker's hand but Watson had grounded his bat in time.
McMillan to Hussey, 1 run yeah you guessed right. Yet another slow one. Off break,. outside off stump, Hussey waits and waits, drives to long off

Gillespie to Hussey, (no ball) The off stump goes for a walk but hold on .. its a no ball. Sorrow for the bowler, joy for Hussey. Hussey backed away and is beaten on the drive by a yorker on the off stump.
Gillespie to Hussey, 1 leg bye length-delivery, angling in on the middle and leg, tries to lap it away, and it rolls of the pad

Gillespie to Watson, SIX runs Whack. Watson takes one step back with his front leg and then thrusts forward, like a baseball hitter, and swing a fullish delivery outside off over cover. Flat and fast. Screaming six.
Gillespie to Watson, 2 runs He goes again, gets a bit too under the delivery and it lands in no man's land beyond cover
Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs Cute. Shuffles across and paddle scoops, laps it over short fine leg. Ala Ashraful. Of course had he missed, I would have written too cute for his own comfort.
Gillespie to Watson, FOUR runs Whoosh! Disappears to the midwicket boundary. It was a slower one, ends up as a low full-toss, on the off stump and clubbed over midwicket.

Gillespie to Watson, SIX runs Leading edge to six over long on. Hmm... Gillespie went round the stumps, bowled one fullish, on leg and middle, Watson tried to loft it over wide midwicket, got a leading edge and it flew over the ropes.
Patel to Hayden, no run slow in the air, lands on the middle and off, turns towards off, dabbed away to the off side.
Patel to Hayden, 2 runs fuller, on the off stump line, swept to long leg where McMillan fumbles and gives away an extra run

Patel to Hayden, 1 run flighted, really slow in the air, Hayden is on the sweep, is made to wait and he takes out the top-hand off the handle, sweeps it to McMillan. No mistake from him this time and the crowd cheer. He smiles.
Patel to Ponting, 1 run on the middle stump line, Ponting paddles it away behind square-leg
Patel to Hayden, 1 run Another sweep, again it is McMillan. Again the crowd give him the full treatment.

Patel to Ponting, OUT Suddenly, against the run of play, Ponting falls. Tossed-up, full in length, on the off stump line, Ponting skips down the track and whips it, but it goes in the air and Ross Taylor, at midwicket, jumps up to grab it. Ponting was trying to get it past
Gillespie to Hayden, no run fullish, almost yorker-length, on the off stump line, jabbed back to the bowler
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run low full-toss, on the off stump line, flat-batted to long off
Gillespie to Clarke, 1 run gets off the mark straightaway with a drive to left of mid-off.
Gillespie to Hayden, FOUR runs Smoked. Hayden was waiting for the Powerplay and heaves a fullish-delivery on the leg and middle over wide mid-on.
Gillespie to Hayden, 1 run low full-toss, on the middle, drilled down the track, Gillespie gets a hand on it and makes a half-stop
Gillespie to Clarke, 1 run outside the off stump, full in length, Clarke drives to left of mid-off where McMillan makes a diving stop
McMillan to Hussey, 1 run backs away, McMillan sends across one of his specials - a slow off break, well outside the off stump and Hussey reaches out, jabs it past point
McMillan to Watson, 2 runs This is interesting. Yet another slower one, again the batsmen is unable to do much with it, shovelled past midwicket

McMillan to Watson, FOUR runs Not any more. Sends this slower one to long on boundary. Watson waited this time and hit it down the ground. Marshall at long on rushed across to his left and threw in a full length dive but can't reach it. One bounce over the ropes
McMillan to Watson, 1 run on the off stump line, late cut to third man
McMillan to Hussey, 1 run full and outside off stump, slicked past cover

McMillan to Watson, 1 run another slow off break, lands outside off stump and turns in. Watson had shuffled across the stumps to play his lap/paddle shot but there is not much pace to work with and he ends up swatting it to short fine leg region
Franklin to Watson, 2 runs moves outside leg stump and slices a fullish delivery towards deep point. Comes back for the second and hello! its his fifty. Breezy knock.
Franklin to Watson, 1 run on the middle and leg, pushed to midwicket for a single. Franklin is bowling from round the stumps
Franklin to Hussey, OUT Fools Hussey with a slower one. From over the wicket, full and outside off, Hussey went down his knee and tried to swing it across the line, got a top edge to square-leg.
Franklin to Watson, SIX runs Up .. up and over long on. Full, from round the stumps, right in the slot and Watson knives through the line.
Franklin to Watson, 2 runs slower ball, on the leg stump line, Watson retains the strike with a push past square-leg.

Franklin to Watson, SIX runs The white ball is flying everywhere. This one, the last ball of the innings, has been sucked over cover. He backed to the leg side and smoked a full-pitched one up and over cover.
In the record chase in Hamilton New Zealand hunted down 346. Today they have to beat that. 349 to win. Can they? The wicket has got a bit slower. Join us in a while to find out.
Right... all set. The chase is about to get underway
Bracken to Fulton, no run starts off in the channel outside off stump, Fulton doesn't like the programming and lets it go past him
Bracken to Fulton, no run And again. Much closer to the off stump this time. The next one should be interesting. I think he will take it away again.
Bracken to Fulton, no run nope. He bends this one back in from middle and leg, it thuds into the pad as Fulton tries to work it to on side and rolls away to square-leg
Bracken to Fulton, 2 runs punched away. Short in length, landed outside off stump, moves away, Fulton stands tall, gets close to the line and forces it away off the back foot, through cover point.
Bracken to Fulton, no run back to regular programming. Whizzes past the off stump, left alone
Bracken to Fulton, no run back of length, outside off stump, angling away, Fulton pushes at it, bat-face shuts and rolls over the leg side
Tait to Fleming, no run short of length, outside the off stump, Fleming drops his wrists and lets it sail past him. He then practises a cut shot. Hindsight is so wonderful.
Tait to Fleming, no run fuller, closer to the off stump, Fleming leans forward and shoulders arms at the last minute
Tait to Fleming, 1 run kicks up from short of length, on the middle and leg, jabbed away behind square-leg. He took out the bottom-hand of the handle and fended it away

Tait to Fulton, 1 wide banged in short, lost control at the release, right arm fell over at an awkward angle and the ball slips down leg side. It's Tait. By this time you would have got used to all this.
Tait to Fulton, no run again banged in short, it whizzes just past the leg stump, Very close to the body and Asad Rauf thinks its too close to call a wide.
Tait to Fulton, no run fuller, on a length, outside the off stump, goes on straight, left alone
Tait to Fulton, 1 run hits the deck short of length, kicks up just below chest, on the middle and leg, Fulton stands on his toes, gets on top of the bounce, tucks it behind square-leg
Bracken to Fulton, 1 run On the middle and leg, fullish, Fleming leans across, falls over a touch, flicks to square-leg
Bracken to Fleming, no run
Bracken to Fleming, SIX runs No falling over this time. He leans across to a full-pitched delivery on middle and leg and picks it up over midwicket. It flies over the ropes. Nonchalantly hit.
Bracken to Fleming, no run leans across, pushes a length-delivery to cover
Bracken to Fleming, 1 run full and outside off stump, Fleming glides towards the line, drives powerfully to left of mid-off

Bracken to Fulton, 3 runs slightly slower, on the off stump line, short in length and Fulton punches it through covers. All the force was given at the point of impact. The bat came down and he punched on contact. Fisted it through.
Tait to Fulton, 1 run banged in short, at the body, on middle and leg, Fulton is caught in a tangle but he adjusts to swipe it away, pulls it away with a bit of top edge to fine leg

Tait to Fleming, FOUR runs edged past second slip. Full in length, slanting away from Fleming who shuffled across, had a flash and it flew past Ponting. It would have gone straight to third slip. Tait is not amused. Bouncer coming up, surely.

Tait to Fleming, OUT gets him with a bouncer. Fleming is not happy. Banged in short, on the middle and off, Fleming tries to pull off the front foot, the ball bounces more than he anticipated, and thudded into his left arm before bobbing away to Ponting at second slip. They

Tait to Taylor, no run fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, Taylor tries to flick it, loses balance in the process, falls over a touch and inside-edges it on to the pad. Can we play straight when we are new to the crease please?!
Tait to Taylor, no run Fires in a 151 k bouncer, ducked under
Tait to Taylor, no run full-pitched on the middle and leg, flicked to right of Hussey, who is standing at backward square-leg and he dives to make the stop.
Bracken to Fulton, no run full in length, on the middle and off, moves towards off, Fulton leans forward, pats it towards cover. NZ need a further 328 to win
Bracken to Fulton, FOUR runs pulled away. Short in length, on the middle and off and Fulton leant back to pull it just behind square.
Bracken to Fulton, no run length-delivery, on the middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
Bracken to Fulton, 1 run off break, lands on middle and off, moves away towards off, punched past the bowler
Bracken to Taylor, no run 121 k delivery, on a length, around middle stump line, moves away towards middle and off, worked towards midwicket
Bracken to Taylor, 3 runs fuller, pushed across Taylor who jumps at it, slices it through point. Clarke gives the chase, pulls it back.

McGrath to Taylor, OUT McGrath gets a wicket off his first ball. Wicket no 66 for him in World cups. Banged in short, Taylor is on the front foot, goes for a pull from there and hits straight to midwicket. McGrath is obviously happy. Looks at the batsman, claps before runni
McGrath to Styris, 2 runs Another short pitched stuff, even better, just outside off stump, but Styris pulls it in front of square
McGrath to Styris, (no ball) outside the offstump, goes for a drive but doesn't connect
McGrath to Styris, no run again outside off, left alone this time
McGrath to Styris, no run lands on a length, outside off stump, cuts in a touch, Styris lunges forward, it gets big on him and he lets it go through to Gilchrist
McGrath to Styris, FOUR runs crack. Well outside the off stump and Styris frees his arm at the width. It screams through cover.

McGrath to Styris, no run bottom-edge but it didn't carry to Gilchrist. Just short of the lunging keeper. It was short in length and outside off, Styris pulled it, got a bottom-edge and luckily, for him ie, it fell just short.
Bracken to Fulton, no run full in length, on the off stump, punched to mid-off

Bracken to Fulton, FOUR runs edged between Gilchrist and a diving Hayden, who is standing wide at second slip position. Full in length, breaks away as Bracken delivers with a off break action, Fulton goes for a drive on the up and got an outside edge
Bracken to Fulton, 1 run
Bracken to Styris, 1 wide way outside the off stump, left alone
Bracken to Styris, no run closer to the off stump, punched to cover
Bracken to Styris, no run outside the off stump, left alone
Bracken to Styris, no run off cutter, slower one, 114 k, on the off stump line, guided to point
McGrath to Fulton, 1 run fullish, well outside off stump, Fulton drives to left of mid-off
McGrath to Styris, FOUR runs full and outside the off stump, Styris glides forward and square-drives past point. he waited a touch on it to get the placement right. Very well played
McGrath to Styris, FOUR runs And again. On a length, outside the off stump, Styris thrusted his left leg across and punches it on the up past point.
McGrath to Styris, 2 runs well outside the off stump, on a length, carved away to wide third man
McGrath to Styris, no run 133k, length-delivery, around the off stump, closer this time, left alone
McGrath to Styris, no run
Tait to Fulton, 1 wide way outside the off stump. Wide. Tait. Are they synonyms?
Tait to Fulton, FOUR runs Whack. Brutal pull. Short in length, just outside the off stump and Fulton swivelled and pulled it in front of the square.
Tait to Fulton, 1 run short of length, outside the off stump, holds its line, Fulton goes back and across, slashes it down to third man

Tait to Styris, FOUR runs Up.. .up and over square-leg and gravity brought it down just before the ropes. Short in length, outside off stump, Styris goes for a pull and gets under it a touch, and ends up skying it high.
Tait to Styris, 1 run fuller, on the middle stump line, driven to wide of mid-on
Tait to Fulton, 1 run almost at the yorker-length, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket

Tait to Styris, (no ball) No ball called. Asad Rauf gets it wrong. He had some part of the feet planted behind the line. Hmm... short of length, outside off stump, left alone. The back foot also just cleared the return crease.
Tait to Styris, FOUR runs full-pitched, on the middle and Styris goes down the ground with a pleasing drive past the bowler.
McGrath to Fulton, no run
McGrath to Fulton, 2 runs Overpitched outside off and Fulton creams it through cover. He is looking good. No.. Kiwi fans .. I am not woofing him.
McGrath to Fulton, no run on a length, around off stump line, punched to cover
McGrath to Fulton, 1 run slower, full and on the off and middle, driven to mid-on
McGrath to Styris, 1 run banged in short, it rises above waist-high, pulled to deep square-leg. Styris reaches the other end and suggests he should have placed it better.
McGrath to Fulton, 1 run full in length, on the middle, pushed down the ground. McGrath goes up in appeal for a lbw, but imo the ball hit the bat first.
Tait to Fulton, no run full in length, outside the offstump line, driven to cover
Tait to Fulton, no run
Tait to Fulton, no run full in length, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler

Tait to Fulton, 1 run That's mighty close. It hit the pad first. Full in length, lands just outside off stump, slants in, Fulton goes for a drive, bat comes outside the line, the ball thuds into the pad in front of off stump. Hmm.. that was hitting the middle. Maybe the um
Tait to Styris, no run fullish, on the middle and off, pushedb back to the bowler
Tait to Styris, 1 run
McGrath to McMillan, no run greets McMillan with a yorker. Late in swing as well, on the middle stump line, jabbed away to the on side
McGrath to McMillan, no run McMillan backs away, this is just his second ball. McGrath fires it outside off stump, he reaches it, carves it to point
McGrath to McMillan, no run driven straight to short extra cover, full from McGrath and keeping it tight
McGrath to McMillan, 1 run backs away again and cuts it to third man for a single. McMillan has arrived as if he's a man on a mission. Daring in every sense
McGrath to Fulton, 1 run full on middle, turned away to square leg for a single
Tait to Fulton, no run full and swinging from outside off, driven back to the bowler
Tait to Fulton, 1 run short outside off and that's a whistling pull shot from Fulton. Sweeper cleans up in the square leg boundary.

Tait to McMillan, OUT nailed 'em. Full length ball pitching on off and rattling McMillan's pads. It strikes him on middle and, despite Tait delivering from a wide angle, it would have gone on to hit leg stump. Asad Rauf waits for the long appeal to subside before lifting t
Tait to Franklin, 2 runs short ball and it's pulled away to square for a couple. Not in control of the shot
Tait to Franklin, 1 wide wide outside off, wayward this time
Tait to Franklin, no run full ball on off, driven to short extra cover. Can't beat the fielder
Tait to Franklin, no run defended to covers
Hogg to Fulton, no run on the middle and leg, flicked to short fine leg
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run
Hogg to Franklin, no run lands on the off stump, spins away sharply, pushed to mid-off
Hogg to Franklin, 1 run fuller, flighted, swept with a bit of inside-edge to behind square-leg
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run tossed-up, on the middle, flicked past midwicket
Hogg to Franklin, 1 run slightly short, on the off and middle, worked through midwicket region
Watson to Franklin, no run
Watson to Franklin, 2 runs short of length, on the off stump line, punched through midwicket

Watson to Franklin, OUT done by the change of pace. Around 111k slower one, full and outside off, Franklin goes for a drive, is early into the stroke, gets a inside-edge and drags on to the stumps. Five down and boy are they wobbling or what?

Watson to McCullum, no run fullish, outside off, driven to cover. Watson appeals for a lbw, he thinks the ball hit the pad first. He was right but the point of impact was just outside off stump. Asad Rauf gets it right.
Watson to McCullum, 1 wide way down the leg side.
Watson to McCullum, no run
Watson to McCullum, 2 runs on the middle and leg, worked through midwicket region
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run full and outside off, Fulton thrashes it down the ground to McGrath at long on
Hogg to McCullum, no run
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run loopy delivery, dips on the middle, driven to cover point
Hogg to Fulton, no run leans forward, drives to backward point
Hogg to Fulton, 2 runs slightly short and pulled away to left of long leg
Hogg to Fulton, 2 runs low dipping full-toss, outside off stump, Fulton drives, it runs off the bottom half of the bat through point
Watson to McCullum, no run full in length, outside the off stump, McCullum squaredrives but can't beat Clarke at point who dives to his right
Watson to McCullum, 1 run McCullum walks down the track, Watson hits the deck short of length, on the off sutmp line, stabs at it, gets a inside-edge to fine leg
Watson to Fulton, 1 run on the off and middle, short of length, Fulton shuffles across, tucks it past square-leg
Watson to McCullum, no run
Watson to McCullum, no run length-delivery, outside off stump, comes in a touch, McCullum gets across, pushes at it and it hits the pad, but outside the off stump
Watson to McCullum, no run And again, the ball rolls over towards cover.
Hogg to Fulton, 2 runs on the leg stump line, paddled away to fine leg
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run on the middle, turns in, clipped to long leg
Hogg to McCullum, no run floated outside off stump, McCullum shapes to nudge it to off side, gets an inside edge as the ball turns in
Hogg to McCullum, no run on the middle and off, dabbed to the off side
Hogg to McCullum, 1 run tossed up outside off stump and swept away to long leg
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run And again.
Watson to Fulton, no run fullish, outside off stump, driven to cover
Watson to Fulton, no run on the middle stump line, flicked straight to midwicket
Watson to Fulton, 2 runs slightly slower one, outside off stump, stabbed away to backward point region
Watson to Fulton, no run
Watson to Fulton, 2 runs slipping on to the pads, glanced away behind square-leg
Watson to Fulton, no run short of length, outside offstump, punched to point where Symonds fields.

Hogg to McCullum, no run loud shout for a catch at silly point. McCullum charged down the track, Hogg dragged back the length and it spun in with bit of bounce, McCullum tries to tuck ti to on side, misses and it bobs off the thigh pad and Ponting dives to grab it. Hogg ap
Hogg to McCullum, 2 runs spins down the leg side, tucked to fine leg
Hogg to Vettori, no run on the off stump line, dabbed to backward point
Hogg to Vettori, FOUR runs short and Vettori pulls it fiercely, almost took out Ponting at short leg, to midwicket boundary
Hogg to Vettori, no run almost fools him with the googly. It landed outside off stump, broke back in, Vettori is cramped for room and ends up jabbing it away
Watson to Fulton, no run on a length, around off stump, driven to mid-on
Watson to Fulton, 2 runs leans forward to a length-delivery outside off, punches it through backward point. Fifty up for Fulton. 2nd World cup fifty and the 4th one against Australia
Watson to Fulton, no run fuller and outside off stump, square-driven to Symonds at cover point
Watson to Fulton, no run on a length, outside off stump, pushed to cover
Watson to Fulton, no run bouncer, on the leg and middle line, ducked under
Watson to Fulton, no run full-pitched outside off stump, driven straight to cover
Hogg to Gillespie, no run turns in from outside off, gets a inside edge on to the pad
Hogg to Gillespie, no run tossed-up, outside off, driven to mid-off
Hogg to Gillespie, no run huge shout for a catch at short leg. On the middle and leg, Gillespie tries to paddle it away, misses and it bobs of the thigh pad to Ponting under the helmet.
Hogg to Gillespie, no run
Hogg to Gillespie, no run turns in from outside off, Gillespie goes back, nudges it to the off side
Watson to Fulton, no run on the off stump line, tucked to square-leg
Watson to Fulton, no run on the off stump line, comes in a touch, punched back to the bowler
Watson to Fulton, FOUR runs Whipped away. Back of length, on the middle and off stump line, Fulton waits for it before whipping to deep midwicket. Very well placed.
Watson to Fulton, 1 run length-delivery outside off stump, pushed through the cover region
Watson to Gillespie, 1 run
Watson to Fulton, 1 run on the middle and off, turned to right of mid-on where Hogg makes the stop and fires in an throw at non-striker's end. Misses.
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run spins in from outside off, Fulton goes back, waits for the turn, tucks it behind square-leg
Hogg to Gillespie, 1 run on the middle and leg, clipped to behind square-leg
Hogg to Fulton, no run fuller, on the off stump line, flicked to the on side
Hogg to Fulton, 1 run shortish, on the leg and middle, lapped around the corner, behind square-leg
Hogg to Fulton, 1 wide down the leg side, spins away, Fulton lets it go past him. Wide called.

Hogg to Fulton, FOUR runs slightly short, on the middle and leg, Fulton pulls, in the air, past square-leg. Catch it was Gilchrist's call ..... er... can we get the opposition get a few boundaries at least?
Tait to Mason, no run full, 138.7 kph, on the off and middle, dug out back to the bowler
Tait to Mason, no run off cutter, on the off and middle, defended back to the bowler
Tait to Mason, 1 wide banged in short but it sails down leg side
Tait to Mason, no run fuller, on the off stump line, cuts in, driven to mid-off
Tait to Mason, no run from wide of the crease, on the middle, turned towards midwicket.
Tait to Patel, no run full in length, outside stump, driven to the off side
Hogg to Fulton, no run full and on the stumps, pushed to cover
Hogg to Fulton, no run defended back to Hogg
Hogg to Fulton, no run leans forward, pushes to cover
Hogg to Fulton, no run on the middle and leg, turned to square-leg
This is Sriram Veera, your commentator for the day, signing off. Adios.
Man-of-the-Match Matthew Hayden
Australian fielders huddle together in celebration. This is their 21st consecutive win in World Cups. Australia win by 215 runs. Massive. This is New Zealand's biggest defeat in ODIs.
Australia won by 215 runs
Player of the match is Matthew Hayden, AUS
